svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
January 22, 2017" date: "2017-01-22"
News and Links
Top
* Integrating Zcash on Ethereum – a precompiled Ethereum contract where the zksnark
proof took only 42 miliseconds!? Practically, what can zksnarks do and what can’t they
do?
* Practically, what can zksnarks do and what can’t they do?
Stuff for Dapp developers
* Machinomy - directed off-chain state channel JavaScript library
Machinomy - directed off-chain state channel JavaScript library
* Typed, functional demo Solidity language that targets the EVM.
Typed, functional demo Solidity language that targets the EVM.
* Passing variable-size data between contracts
Passing variable-size data between contracts
* SmartPool’s Donation Contract Explained
SmartPool’s Donation Contract Explained
* 512-bit Big int library
512-bit Big int library
* Delib - apromise based library that provides the core abstractions needed for
building DApps on Ethereum
Delib - apromise based library that provides the core abstractions needed for building
DApps on Ethereum
Clients and releases
* Parity v1.5: Multisig wallets, contract deployment, auto-updating, PoA/dev chains,
verification badges, etc
* Etheruby - release candidate 2
Protocol
* Interesting empirical data on what PoS has meant for stakers so far in the crypto
world
Ecosystem
* Status.im Ethereum Thought Leader series had 3 more: Viktor Trón (and Part 2) , Dr.
Greg Colvin , and Fabian Vogelsteller
Status.im Ethereum Thought Leader series had 3 more: Viktor Trón (and Part 2) , Dr.
* Why Fred Ehrsam is leaving Coinbase : to pursue working on Ethereum
Why Fred Ehrsam is leaving Coinbase : to pursue working on Ethereum
* Let me advertise for my competition: Taylor Gerring has started a Ethereum-heavy
blockchain news vlog
Let me advertise for my competition: Taylor Gerring has started a Ethereum-heavy
* If you got hacked by someone stealing your cell number, you should do this now .
These telcoms are going to get sued, and they deserve to be held liable for their
negligence.
If you got hacked by someone stealing your cell number, you should do this now .
* These telcoms are going to get sued, and they deserve to be held liable for their
Project Updates
* Podcast: Joey Krug talks Augur in 2017
* Decentralized Capital’s IDEX – live on testnet
Token Sales
* Fred Ehrsam: Value in token models
Fred Ehrsam: Value in token models
* Creating Interoperable Blockchains with Cosmos Differences between Cosmos and
Polkadot
Creating Interoperable Blockchains with Cosmos
* Differences between Cosmos and Polkadot
* Matchpool – Disrupting the Dating Industry via Blockchain Why they’re building
Matchpool CoinFund video Q&A with Matchpool
Matchpool – Disrupting the Dating Industry via Blockchain
* Why they’re building Matchpool
Why they’re building Matchpool
* CoinFund video Q&A with Matchpool
CoinFund video Q&A with Matchpool
* Melonport token sale documents
Melonport token sale documents
General
* Full stack Hello World Voting Ethereum dapp tutorial - Part 1
Full stack Hello World Voting Ethereum dapp tutorial - Part 1
* 7 Euro banks form Digital Trade Chain group using Ethereum prototype.
7 Euro banks form Digital Trade Chain group using Ethereum prototype.
* Hashrate is at an all time high .
Hashrate is at an all time high .
* Consensys’s Andrew Keys: The world has a trust problem. Personal responsibility &
Ethereum are the solutions.
Consensys’s Andrew Keys: The world has a trust problem. Personal responsibility &
Dates of note
* Jan 26 – Status.im release Alexey Ankunov, Pelle Braendgaard and Taylor Gerring
videos
Jan 26 – Status.im release Alexey Ankunov, Pelle Braendgaard and Taylor Gerring videos
* Jan 27-29 – Thomson Reuters “Hack the Valley” hackathon
Jan 27-29 – Thomson Reuters “Hack the Valley” hackathon
* Feb 1 – Contingency sale begins
Feb 1 – Contingency sale begins
* Feb 13 – Intellisys private equity “Mainstreet fund ” sale begins (closed to US/EU
citizens, KYC done by exchange for initial purchase and for dividends)
Feb 13 – Intellisys private equity “Mainstreet fund ” sale begins (closed to US/EU
* Feb 14 – Chronobank sale ends
Feb 14 – Chronobank sale ends
* Feb 15 – Melonport sale begins (must check a box that you aren’t US citizen)
Feb 15 – Melonport sale begins (must check a box that you aren’t US citizen)
* Feb 17-18 – Ethereum Euro Dev Conference in Paris
Feb 17-18 – Ethereum Euro Dev Conference in Paris
* Feb – Cosmos token sale begins
Feb – Cosmos token sale begins
* “Feb/Mar” – iEx.ec token sale begins
“Feb/Mar” – iEx.ec token sale begins
* “Late Mar” – Matchpool token sale begins
“Late Mar” – Matchpool token sale begins
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as
to even whether they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether
any will produce a satisfactory return. This is not investment advice.]
Enforce the trademark?
Barry Silbert’s decision to try to mislead investors by calling his EthClassic fund
the “Ethereum Investment Trust” triggered much debate in the community this week.
I consider myself neutral here. As I understand the law, Ethereum may lose control of
the Ethereum name if it doesn’t enforce its trademark (as Joe Lubin says ). On the
other hand, pursuing legal enforcement of the trademark probably means that only
lawyers win in the long-term.
My thought : send a cease and desist letter that includes strong language warning
about how investors will likely be mislead because we’ve already seen that occur.
Silbert would have a small PR victory among the shrill group of libertarians who
believe that all IP is bad. But he’ll also have to think twice about whether the name
is really worth it – because any unhappy investor in the future would have a piece of
evidence to bolster a claim that they were mislead.
Sharing
If this issue was useful to you, would you share it on social media or email it to a
friend?
Just in case you want to send Ether (or tokens?):
0x96d4F0E75ae86e4c46cD8e9D4AE2F2309bD6Ec45
Week in Ethereum News
